intro: Mesembryanthemum tulbaghense, commonly known as the Tulbagh groundsel, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of the Western and Eastern Cape provinces. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in dry climates.
